intro: Canthium macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
